result.execSummary:
The defendant Jessie L. Merrill was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence she is currently serving.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay restitution, joint and several with Delores Seif, in the amount of $623.84. 
25% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.
Not to be in Walmart in Stevens Point unless they consent and agent consents.

Participate in any other assessment or counseling deemed appropriate. 
Provide DNA sample, if requested. 
Write a letter of apology to Walmart.
Obtain AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence she is currently serving.

records.addlTxt: of Conviction and Order - ERP /s/ TBE 05/31/17  **faxed to 262-878-6016, Attn:  M Hoffman; mailed copy to TCI Records Staff on 06/01/17; copies provided to ADA DK and Atty Drengler sp
Transcript of Plea and Sentencing Hearing held on July 7, 2016

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Restitution Summary Joint/Several filed by the State

Defendant Jessie L. Merrill in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Defendant Jessie L. Merrill in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
12:23 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of:  NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
Atty Drengler agrees to repeat enhancer. 

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
1 year 1 day initial confinement followed by 2 years extended supervision, consecutive to any other sentence she is currently serving. 
1 day credit. 
Not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.  
Eligible for Substance Abuse Program. 
Conditions of Extended Supervision:
Obtain AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Maintain Fulltime employment.
Participate in any other assessment or counseling deemed appropriate.
Provide DNA sample, if requested. 
Write letter of apology to Walmart.
Not be in Walmart in Stevens Point unless they consent and agent consents.
Pay Restitution, joint and several with Delores Seif, in the amount of $623.84.  
Pay costs. 
25% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.

Atty Knaapen makes statements to the Court regarding the initial confinement amount.

Defendant Jessie L. Merrill in court with attorney Acalia N Halverson appearing specially for Atty Ryan Drengler. Defendant Jessie L. Merrill in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:34 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 09:30 am.
